ray.rage.game

Interface Game

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Manageable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractGame, BaseGame, VariableFrameRateGame

    public interface Game
extends Manageable
    A game is the basic interface clients implement to have access to the framework and its functionality.
    Author:
    Raymond L. Rivera

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Game.State
      The state is used to inform and determine some aspects of a game's behavior.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void exit()
      Causes the game to return terminate execution and return a value to the operating system.
      Engine getEngine()
      Gets the game's reference to the engine and allows it to access its functionality.
      Game.State getState()
      Gets the current state of the game.
      void run()
      Places the game in the running state, enters the main loop, and actually allows it to be playable.
      void setState(Game.State state)
      Sets the game's state to the specified value.

      • Methods inherited from interface ray.rage.common.Manageable

        shutdown, startup

    • Method Detail

      • run

        void run()
        Places the game in the running state, enters the main loop, and actually allows it to be playable.

      • exit

        void exit()
        Causes the game to return terminate execution and return a value to the operating system.

      • setState

        void setState(Game.State state)
        Sets the game's state to the specified value.
        Parameters:
        state - The state to set the game to.

      • getState

        Game.State getState()
        Gets the current state of the game.
        Returns:
        The current state.

      • getEngine

        Engine getEngine()
        Gets the game's reference to the engine and allows it to access its functionality.
        Returns:
        The engine.
